HR GENERALIST

and reports

notes

privacy related to employee relations issues, organizational changes, planning
with a strict adherence to privacy and confidentiality per company policy

management, and senior leadership team

training, and creating strategic HR initiatives.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Talent Acquisition Analyst

Location: Richmond, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Human Resources, Project Management

Description:
Bip.Monticello is looking for a highly motivated and entrepreneurial Talent Acquisition superstar to join its growing team. If you are interested in learning about management consulting in the fields of financial services, life sciences, and technology while accelerating the development of your recruiting toolkit, this is the ideal role for you! Apply today to join an exciting, entrepreneurial firm that will help take your career to the next level!
This position is responsible for Talent Acquisition but will also support HR Operations and potentially other functions. An example of weekly responsibilities includes:
1) Sourcing and screening talent, shepherding candidates through the talent acquisition lifecycle, and metric reporting. 75% of the week.
2) Working with HR, Recruiting, Talent Management, and Operations on important business initiatives. 10-15% of the week.
3) Assist as a support system to firm operations and client delivery who is responsible for handling and performing day-to-day HR functions. 10-15% of the week.
Role Responsibilities & Experience:
Recruiting:
5+ Years of recruiting for roles in the following industries: Financial Services/Capital Markets, Life Sciences, & Technology (esp. Data Analysts/Data Scientists). Responsible for finding talent, owning the recruiting lifecycle, and various HR tasks and metric reporting.Utilize effective communication skills to directly contact candidates, all while providing exceptional customer service as a Bip.Monticello ambassador.Source and recruit candidates by using databases, social media etc., screen candidates resumes and job applications, and conduct interviews using various reliable recruiting and selection tools/methods to filter candidates.Help manage the interview process from start to finish by coordinating with hiring managers and documenting feedback.Manage the existing pipeline of candidates and identify future opportunities for growth while providing a world-class candidate experience.Exceed team hiring goals by proactively sourcing top talent from a variety of channels.Review and create compelling job descriptions for job postings to attract talent.Candidate should be an expert networker and able to leverage and network with top talent for referrals.
Operations Support:
Oversee strategic business initiatives from development through successful execution under the guidance of senior leadership and departmental heads.Oversee daily operations through collaboration with senior management and department leaders, performing an array of administrative tasks from managing calendars, generating correspondence, maintaining hard copy and electronic files, planning and coordinating annual corporate meetings, and scheduling facilities.
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Finance, Economics, Management, Business preferred.
**The base salary range for this role is $40,000-$80,000**
Take the Next Step – Join Us Today!
We are looking for leaders that will effectively drive the future success of both our firm and our clients as we continue up the steep trajectory of Bip.Monticello’s growth story. By joining the multi-national Bip Group in early 2022, our firm transformed into a top global consulting firm while remaining a flat, focused enterprise where true teamwork, compassion, and collaboration remain as key ingredients of our culture. There has never been a more exciting time to join our team!Bip.Monticello provides a competitive salary, health and dental & vision insurance, a 401K plan with match, along with paid time off benefits. 
For more information about life at Bip.Monticello, visit https://www.monticellocg.com.
It is Bip.Monticello policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals based on job-related qualifications and ability to perform a job, without regard to age, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or marital status, and to maintain a non-discriminatory environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias based upon these grounds.
Bip.Monticello provides a reasonable range of compensation for our roles. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, education, level of experience, and knowledge.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
<JD_END>
